Lhuan-dre Pretorius may be living life in the fast lane at the Paarl Royals in the SA20 , but the teenager’s dad Abe is still picking up traffic fines.Pretorius has burst on the global cricket scene in spectacular fashion with the former South Africa U-19 star smashing two half-centuries in three matches to top the SA20 run-scorers list.He has surprised many with the maturity he’s shown at the crease.Unfazed at the prospect of facing up to the likes of Trent Boult, Kagiso Rabada, Marco Jansen and Ottniel Baartman.But Abe Pretorius - Lhuan-dre’s father - claims his son is still just a normal teen finding his way in the world.“I remember when Anrich Nortje bowled to him. He told me an interesting story: ‘Dad, I wasn’t scared of the ball. I was more scared of me running into him because I saw it on TV.’ He was never afraid. Pace never bothered him,” said the senior Pretorius.“But he’s still a baby. He’s only 18. He has a mustache. But his beard is soft. He's still a kid and sometimes I forget.“But he's also not a kid getting all the speed fines. The car is still in my name. It's crazy!”The Pretorius family have certainly been there to support Lhuan-dre and fellow South African schools prodigy Vihan - ‘he’s my baby and can do no wrong’ - cricket aspirations since they first picked up a cricket bat.Abe installed a training net at their home in Potchefstroom early on and since they stayed close to Senwes Park - home of the North West Dragons - would regularly take his sons there to train.Lhuan-dre, therefore, had the privilege of spending time with the likes of SA20 stars Bjorn Fortuin and Rassie van der Dussen from a very young age.“He always wanted to play the game. He was brought up next to the field at Senwes Park. So, I was privileged to have a hospitality suite there. And that’s where he met Bjorn and Rassie.“He always played with them or next to the field to see them playing. And that's what's so nice. He plays now with Bjorn. There's a bit of banter going on between them.”At this critical age parents can often become over-indulged with their children’s sporting careers, forcing them to train when they may no longer enjoy it.Abe was never confronted with this issue.“He lives for cricket. He YouTubes cricket every night. I don’t think he’s watched a cartoon ever in his life. From a young age, before any big game, he would wake me up at five.“And we had a net in our yard at the back. So I needed to throw to him before school. And when he gets picked up and then he's ready in the afternoon.“I think more waking him up for academics. He never wanted to study. That was a headache and we had to get a tutor to assist him.”Whilst it was almost the perfect childhood growing up in Potchefstroom, the major cricket-playing high schools are based in Johannesburg. That’s close to 120 kilometres away.It is common practice for young South African boys to leave their family homes at 12-13 years old after being afforded scholarships to attend these ivy-league schools as hostel boarders.But Abe was having none of it. Instead, he packed up and relocated the entire family to “The Big Smoke” - as Johannesburg is colloquially referred to - for Lhuan-dre to attend the prestigious St Stithians College - alma mater of Kagiso Rabada, Grant Elliot and a certain Kwena Maphaka.The latter is, of course, the same age as Lhuan-dre with their cricket journeys following an almost identical path. They played together at school, youth provincial Lions teams, SA U19, and now at the Royals.And according to Abe, it's Lhuan-dre, who kept wicket for most of this period, that knows how to inspire the tearaway rookie fast bowler.“Lhuan-dre knew just how to switch Kwena on. He would always go up to Kwena and whisper something in his ear, and Kwena would get spitting mad,” he said.“After that, Kwena would run through the teams. There are a lot of video clips of when they were at school together, especially when Lhuan-dre was keeping. They were a mean team.”With Lhuan-dre being a left-handed opening batter that keeps wicket, has Gunn & Moore as his bat sponsor, and also having an aversion to a prospective academic career, the comparisons with Proteas and Durban's Super Giants star Quinton de Kock were inevitable.But according to Abe, Lhuan-dre would not want it any other way, and is looking forward to the Royals’ first clash against the Super Giants at Kingsmead on Thursday, January 23.“He’s had a photo up of Quinny since he was very young. He’s still Quinny’s biggest fan. He simply loved Quinny.“Everything about him is Quinny. Yeah, I think you're going to see when they're going to play each other. It's going to be a challenge. I think he's going to be a star-struck!"Everything is happening at the speed of light for Pretorius right now. If he maintains this early season momentum through SA20 Season 3, it would not be far too to suggest that the powerful left-hander could come into the reckoning as a potential replacement at the Indian Premier League (IPL) in the near future.So, how does a father keep a teenager in check when the whole world suddenly wants to give him everything his heart has always desired?“I'm Afrikaans! That's all. He knows me. I don’t play.“I'm a mining oak and I'm Afrikaans. So, he'll know his way.“That's a cultural thing. He knows how it works. You stay humble.”
Article Summary: Lhuan-dre Pretorius has scored two half-centuries in three matches for the Paarl Royals in the SA20. The 18-year-old has surprised many with the maturity he’s shown at the crease. Abe Pretorius says his son is still a normal teen finding his way in the world.

Article Title: Rohit Sharma bats in the nets ahead of England series and Champions Trophy
Article Text: NEW DELHI: India captain Rohit Sharma is going through a horrifying run with the bat. Poor Test returns in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Australia have definitely added to the pressure on the Indian captain.But with the ODI series against England set to begin from February 6 in Nagpur, the 'Hitman' is looking to bounce back in his most favoured format - as he is the only cricketer in the world to hit three double hundreds in ODI cricket.The three-ODI series against England is scheduled to end on February 12 and it will be followed by the Champions Trophy Ahead of the grueling season, Rohit shared a video on Instagram of batting in the nets .The video has Rohit taking a middle stump guard and taking on the pacers with aplomb, going for his shots including his favourite pull shot.Rohit, who retired from T20Is after leading India to the T20 World Cup title in the West Indies in June last year, last played an ODI in August 2024 against Sri Lanka.Poor form notwithstanding, Rohit has been a colossus for India in white-ball cricket with 10866 runs from 265 matches, with 31 hundreds and 57 fifties.
Article Summary: India captain Rohit Sharma is going through a horrifying run with the bat. Poor Test returns in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Australia have added to the pressure on the Indian captain. The ODI series against England set to begin from February 6 in Nagpur.

Article Title: Erling Haaland extends Manchester City stay until 2034
Article Text:
(Photo credit: Manchester City)

NEW DELHI: Manchester City star Erling Haaland on Friday signed a new contract with the Premier League champions that will keep him at the club until 2034.City announced the nine and a half year extension for the 24-year-old striker, who has netted an impressive 111 goals in 126 matches since his arrival from Borussia Dortmund in 2022.The extension marks the longest contract in the league's history, surpassing the nine-year agreement Cole Palmer signed with Chelsea last year. Haaland’s salary is reportedly set at £500,000 ($610,000) per week.Haaland, who joined City in 2022, made an immediate impact by scoring 52 goals across all competitions in his debut season. His stellar performances helped the club secure a historic treble, winning the Champions League, Premier League, and FA Cup. He continued his remarkable form last season, netting 38 goals and contributing to the team’s fourth consecutive league title."I am really happy to have signed my new contract and to be able to look forward to spending even more time at this great club," said a joyous Haaland."Manchester City is a special club, full of fantastic people with amazing supporters, and it's the type of environment that helps bring the best out of everybody."I also want to thank Pep (Guardiola), his coaching staff, my team-mates and everyone at the club as they have all helped me so much in the past couple of years. They have made this such a special place to be and now I am City no matter what."City's outgoing director of football Txiki Begiristain said: "Everyone at the club is absolutely delighted that Erling has signed his new contract."The fact he is signed for so long demonstrates our commitment to him as a player, and his love of this club."He has made an incredible impact already in his time here and his amazing numbers and records speak for themselves."Haaland’s extension comes at a crucial time for City. The team is experiencing an uncharacteristically challenging season, currently sitting sixth in the league, 12 points behind leaders Liverpool.The renewal also highlights the player’s faith in the club amidst ongoing uncertainty surrounding an independent commission hearing regarding alleged breaches of financial regulations—charges City has consistently denied.The announcement follows Pep Guardiola’s decision to extend his contract with the club for two more years, reinforcing City’s stability and ambition for the future.
Article Summary: Erling Haaland signs nine and a half year contract extension with Manchester City. The 24-year-old striker has netted 111 goals in 126 matches since his arrival from Borussia Dortmund in 2022. The extension marks the longest contract in the league's history.

Article Title: Premier League: Amad Diallo scores 12-minute hat-trick to rescue Manchester United against Southampton
Article Text:
Amad Diallo (AP Photo)

NEW DELHI: Amad Diallo's remarkable 12-minute hat-trick rescued Manchester United from a potentially embarrassing defeat against struggling Southampton at Old Trafford on Thursday.The visitors, who are battling to avoid finishing the season as the worst team in Premier League history, took a deserved lead through Manuel Ugarte's own goal late in the first half.Southampton had numerous opportunities to extend their advantage, with Ivan Juric's side playing with confidence and intensity.However, Diallo's introduction in the second half proved to be a game-changer for the hosts.The young forward equalised in the 82nd minute, capitalising on a defensive lapse to score his first goal. Eight minutes later, he latched onto a clever pass from Christian Eriksen to put United ahead.Deep into stoppage time, Diallo completed his hat-trick, taking advantage of another defensive mistake from the visitors.The 3-1 victory provided a much-needed boost for Manchester United, who had endured three consecutive Premier League defeats prior to this match.It also lifted them to 12th in the table, while Southampton remained 10 points adrift of safety.Despite the eventual scoreline, Southampton's performance was commendable, as they caused numerous problems for United's defence throughout the match.Kamaldeen Sulemana was particularly impressive, tormenting the home side's right-back with his pace and trickery.Ruben Amorim's decision to introduce Diallo and make other attacking substitutions proved to be a masterstroke, as the forward's clinical finishing ultimately secured all three points for Manchester United in a match that appeared to be slipping away from them.
Article Summary: Manchester United beat Southampton 3-1 at Old Trafford on Thursday. Amad Diallo scored a hat-trick in the second half. The win lifts United to 12th in the Premier League, while Southampton remain 10 points adrift of safety.

Article Title: Copa del Rey: Endrick scores brace as Real Madrid survive scare to beat Celta Vigo in extra time
Article Text:
Endrick in the middle (AP Photo)

NEW DELHI: Real Madrid overcame a challenging match against Celta Vigo , initially squandering a two-goal lead but ultimately securing a 5-2 victory after extra time in the Copa del Rey quarter-finals on Thursday.Despite a recent defeat to Barcelona in the Supercopa de España final, Madrid's performance, highlighted by two goals from promising talent Endrick , saw them through after a tense match that extended beyond regular time due to Celta Vigo's late equalizer. Kylian Mbappe 's notable performance included a controversial opening goal, followed by Vinicius contributing to Madrid's lead.However, Celta Vigo's persistence paid off with Jonathan Bamba's late goal and Marcos Alonso 's penalty in stoppage time, pushing the game into extra time.In the additional period, Madrid displayed their offensive strength with Endrick scoring his second, Fede Valverde adding another, and Endrick sealing the win with a backheel goal."This is Madrid, you fight until the end to win," said Endrick. "We never go down, we're always fighting... it was a tough game, but we got the goals and we won. We knew that in extra-time we had to run more, do more, get upfield, and we scored three very good goals."Despite the victory, concerns regarding Madrid's defensive stability remain.The match also featured a disallowed goal for Madrid and a notable save by Madrid's goalkeeper, Andriy Lunin."These goals are for Antonio (Rudiger), he knows what he does every day with me," added Endrick, thanking his team-mate for motivating him in training. "These goals are very important for me, I liked this game, this stadium, these fans, and now we have to train, there's more ahead."Other Copa del Rey results saw Osasuna and Real Sociedad advancing past Athletic Bilbao and Rayo Vallecano, respectively, while Barcelona and Atletico Madrid progressed to the quarter-finals on Wednesday.
Article Summary: Real Madrid beat Celta Vigo 5-2 after extra time in Copa del Rey quarter-finals. Kylian Mbappe and Vinicius scored for Real Madrid. Endrick scored two goals for Madrid, Fede Valverde and Endrick sealed win.

Article Title: Copa del Rey: Lamine Yamal stars as Barcelona dominate Real Betis to book quarter-final spot
Article Text:
Barcelona's Lamine Yamal (L) celebrates with teammates after scoring against Real Betis in the Copa del Rey. (AP)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

Barcelona advanced to the quarter-finals of the Copa del Rey with a resounding 5-1 victory over Real Betis on Wednesday. The star of the show was 17-year-old Lamine Yamal , who put on a dazzling display at the Olympic Stadium.Gavi opened the scoring for Barcelona early in the match, and the Catalans continued to dominate with goals from Jules Kounde, Raphinha, Ferran Torres, and Yamal himself. The young winger's performance was particularly impressive, as he scored and helped create two more goals.Barcelona's confidence was high coming into the match, having recently won the Spanish Super Cup in Saudi Arabia by thrashing Real Madrid. Despite resting key players like Robert Lewandowski, the team's attacking prowess was on full display.Pau Cubarsi, a 17-year-old defender who came through Barcelona's youth academy alongside Yamal, praised his teammate's performance."I've been enjoying watching him for many years, now the whole world is, and he deserves it all."Barcelona's dominance was evident from the start, with Dani Olmo, who recently obtained a temporary playing license, starting as a false nine in place of Lewandowski. Olmo was involved in the opening goal and had several chances of his own, hitting the post and firing over.Kounde scored Barcelona's second goal after a sublime pass from Yamal, exploiting the right side of Betis' defense. Although Kounde had a second goal disallowed for a marginal offside, Barcelona continued to create chances.In the second half, Yamal had a goal of his own disallowed for an offside in the build-up, but it didn't matter as Raphinha scored minutes later after another surging run from the young winger. Ferran Torres added a fourth goal, and Yamal finally got on the scoresheet himself with a near-post finish.Betis managed to pull one back from the penalty spot through Vitor Roque, who is on loan from Barcelona, after Kounde fouled Jesus Rodriguez in the area.After the game, Gavi praised Yamal as the best player in the world after Lionel Messi, and coach Hansi Flick also commended the winger's talent."Gavi's very emotional, so I say also yes (he's the best)," joked Flick."You can see it, in great matches you see big talent and he showed it many many times, he's on a good (path)."Yamal, who shone for Spain during their Euro 2024 victory last summer, has an impressive tally of nine goals and 13 assists across all competitions for Barcelona this season.In other Copa del Rey action, Atletico Madrid joined Barcelona in the last eight with a comfortable 4-0 win over second division Elche. This marked Atletico's 15th consecutive victory across all competitions.Atletico coach Diego Simeone rested some of his regular starters, but the team still managed to secure a commanding win. Alexander Sorloth scored twice in the first half, and Elche's chances of a comeback were further diminished when Nico Fernandez was sent off early in the second half.Rodrigo Riquelme and Julian Alvarez added to Atletico's lead, sealing an emphatic victory for the Rojiblancos.The Copa del Rey action continues on Thursday, with defending league champions Real Madrid hosting Celta Vigo and cup holders Athletic Bilbao welcoming Osasuna.
Article Summary: Barcelona defeated Real Betis 5-1 in the Copa del Rey on Wednesday. Lamine Yamal was the star of the show, scoring and setting up two more goals. Atletico Madrid beat Elche 4-0 to join Barcelona in the quarter-finals.

Article Title: Premier League: Arsenal beat Spurs to reignite title challenge, Isak shines for Newcastle
Article Text:
Arsenal players celebrate after Leandro Trossard scored their second goal against Tottenham Hotspur in the Premier League. (AP)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

Record-chasing Isak

Newcastle United's Alexander Isak celebrates after scoring against Wolves in the Premier League. (AP)

London: Arsenal reignited their Premier League title challenge with a 2-1 victory over Tottenham on Wednesday, while Newcastle secured a spot in the top four thanks to a brace from Alexander Isak.In other matches, David Moyes had a disappointing return to the Everton dugout as his team lost 1-0 to Aston Villa at Goodison Park.The win at the Emirates lifts Arsenal to within four points of league leaders Liverpool, who drew 1-1 with Nottingham Forest on Tuesday, and ended a three-match winless run for the Gunners across all competitions.Tottenham took the lead through Son Heung-min in the 25th minute, but Arsenal equalised 15 minutes later when Gabriel's header from a corner deflected off Dominic Solanke for an own goal.Arsenal completed the turnaround just before halftime, with Leandro Trossard blasting a shot past new Spurs goalkeeper Antonin Kinsky.Despite numerous chances to extend their lead, Arsenal failed to do so and had a nervous moment when Pedro Porro hit the post in stoppage time.Arsenal now sits on 43 points after 21 matches, four points behind Liverpool, who have a game in hand.Mikel Arteta, the Arsenal manager, praised his team's performance, calling it "outstanding.""We had some big chances and big situations. At the end we had to suffer more than we wanted," he told the BBC."When you have opportunities (to close the gap) you have to take them. We are on a really consistent run in the Premier League. It's about recovery tomorrow and Aston Villa on Saturday, going and going."The defeat is another setback for injury-plagued Tottenham, who have taken only five points from their last nine Premier League games and have fallen to 13th in the table.Tottenham manager Ange Postecoglou was critical of his team's performance, saying, "Nowhere near good enough, especially in the first half. We were too passive."Newcastle moved into fourth place, ahead of struggling Chelsea, with a 3-0 victory over Wolves, thanks to a record-chasing performance from Isak, who scored for the eighth consecutive league match.Isak's deflected shot off Wolves defender Rayan Ait-Nouri put Newcastle ahead in the 34th minute, and he doubled the lead before the hour mark with his 15th league goal of the season.Anthony Gordon added a third goal for Newcastle."I feel amazing," said Isak, who has Jamie Vardy's record of scoring in 11 straight Premier League games in his sights."Individually I feel free and confident but looking at the team we are doing so well as well, defending and with threats going forward. It is a team and I have to keep contributing with goals."At Goodison Park, Ollie Watkins scored the only goal for Aston Villa in the 51st minute, slotting past England teammate Jordan Pickford after being sent through by Morgan Rogers.Despite their efforts, Everton lacked creativity, which is unsurprising for a team that has scored only 15 league goals in 20 matches this season.The result lifts Aston Villa to seventh in the table, while Everton remain in deep trouble, just one point above the relegation zone in 16th place.Everton, who have been in the top flight since 1954, have struggled against relegation for the past three seasons and are once again in a perilous position.David Moyes, who enjoyed success during his 11-year stint at Goodison Park from 2002 to 2013, was brought back by Everton's new American owners, the Friedkin Group, after they sacked Sean Dyche last week."Obviously it's been a bit of a whirlwind," Moyes said. "Sean Dyche left a group of players that have great character and a great attitude."I'm really pleased to take over that. What I need to do is add quality and find a way of getting results but you can't change the whole thing around straight away."In another match, Leicester suffered their sixth consecutive league defeat, losing 2-0 to Crystal Palace, which leaves them second from bottom in the table.Jean-Philippe Mateta scored for Palace early in the second half, and Marc Guehi secured the points with a late second goal.
Article Summary: Arsenal beat Tottenham Hotspur 2-1 to move within four points of Premier League leaders Liverpool. Newcastle move into fourth place, ahead of struggling Chelsea, with a 3-0 victory over Wolves. Ollie Watkins scored the only goal for Aston Villa in the 51st minute at Goodison Park.

Article Title: Mohammedan rally to hold Chennaiyin
Article Text:
Image credit: ISL

KOLKATA: Mohammedan Sporting overcame a two-goal deficit to hold Chennaiyin FC 2-2, scoring both the goals in stoppage times to script a stunning turnaround at the Kishore Bharati Stadium here on Wednesday.Chennaiyin looked poised to get even with the ISL debutants when they finished the regulation 90 minutes with a 2-0 lead thanks to goals from PC Laldinpuia (10th minute) and Lukas Brambilla (49).As the fourth referee flashed nine minutes of stoppage time on the board, the hosts turned the contest on its head in a remarkable manner.At the heart of their comeback was Manvir Singh Saini. He first struck home the hosts’ first goal and then earned a penalty, which was duly converted by Remsanga Fanai. Mohammedan SC players celebrated the way it was taken as a victory.
Article Summary: Mohammedan Sporting came from two goals down to beat Chennaiyin FC 2-2. PC Laldinpuia and Lukas Brambilla had put Chennai 2-0 up in the 90th minute. Manvir Singh Saini and Remsanga Fanai scored in stoppage time for Mohammedan.

Article Title: Unpaid wages, training boycott? ISL club Mohammedan SC clarify situation
Article Text:
Mohammedan SC (Instagram Photo)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

NEW DELHI: As they say, there is no dull day in Indian football. The latest drama is taking place at Mohammedan SC . Reports emerged on Tuesday from Kolkata's Vivekananda Yuba Bharati Krirangan claiming that Mohammedan players boycotted training ahead of their Indian Super League ( ISL ) home game against Chennaiyin FC , scheduled for January 15. The players were allegedly protesting against three-month unpaid wages.It was further suggested that while the club management had committed to clearing the dues by January 15, players reportedly decided to abstain from training due to a lack of concrete steps from the administration.This news surfaced amid Mohammedan’s resurgence in the ISL, riding on a three-match unbeaten streak. As the team stands second-last on the table, with Hyderabad FC below them, coach Andrey Chernyshov has been working tirelessly to turn their season around.Amid the cub's resurrection, the report of players boycotting training sessions over unpaid dues has raised eyebrows. However, Mohammedan SC have dismissed the rumours.In an exclusive interview with TimesofIndia.com, Mohammedan SC General Secretary Ishtiaque Ahmed, famously known as Raju around the Maidan region, categorically refuted the claims."The reports that have come out are all fake and baseless, and they are being fabricated and posted on Facebook. There is no such issue as players not receiving their payments; all players are being paid. If players were not being paid, how would we be signing new players?" said Ahmed.Despite challenges on the pitch, the Kolkata-based club has been actively reinforcing their squad in recent times. During the current transfer window, MDSC have secured several promising talents, including domestic standouts like Manvir Singh, Mahitosh Roy, Santosh Trophy winner Robi Hansda, and Juwel Ahmed Mazumder.Additionally, foreign signings such as Florent Ogier and Marc Andre Schmerböck have also been added to their ranks. TimesofIndia.com understands that the club is still in pursuit of another striker before the window shuts.Ahmed further clarified the status of training sessions: "Training is ongoing, and it is happening as usual. All the players are attending the training sessions."However, addressing the speculation about finances, Ahmed explained recent changes in the club’s payment structure: "Our payment structure has been changed. Previously, we used to make advance payments to the players before the month ended. But now, we need results. It’s not feasible that the investors keep making payments without getting results in return."The shift in approach extends to the incentive system as well. Ahmed elaborated, "By structure, we mean the incentive system we had. Previously, we provided incentives to all the players. Now, it has been decided that only players who perform well will receive incentives. The players have also been informed that if they do not perform well, their incentives will be cut."Not all squad members have been actively participating in the ISL, with some sidelined due to injuries or suspensions. This has naturally influenced the club’s approach toward incentive payments."Last month, advance payments were not made, but the payments for the previous month have been cleared this month. Previously, we used to make advance payments, but now that is no longer happening."Perhaps the decision to pay players at the end of the month might serve as a motivating factor to inspire better performance, believes the club secretary.On the other hand, refuting the rumours about players boycotting training, Ahmed clarified, "All the players are attending training. The reports that are circulating are speculating that players didn’t show up due to financial reasons, but that’s not true. Some players were given rest, and some were dealing with injuries, which is why the coach didn’t include them in practice sessions."Ahmed also confirmed that there were no hidden financial issues grappling the club: "There are no financial difficulties. If there were any, we would definitely address them openly. Why wouldn’t we say it?"
Article Summary: Mohammedan SC deny reports of players boycotting training over unpaid wages. Club secretary Ishtiaque Ahmed says all players are being paid. Mohammedan are currently second-last in the Indian Super League ( ISL) They face Chennaiyin FC in their next match on January 15.

Article Title: Irked EB seek Mandaviya's intervention
Article Text:
Union sports minister Mansukh Mandaviya

KOLKATA: Describing them as a casualty of continuous poor refereeing calls and highlighting a “step-motherly treatment” in the Indian Super League , East Bengal club has decided to take their grievance to the doorstep of Union sports minister.The club is understood to have sent a missive to Mansukh L Mandaviya on Tuesday night, seeking intervention from him for Indian football ’s sorry state of affairs.East Bengal’s move came close on the heels of their latest loss to Mohun Bagan SG in the ISL during which the club claimed that referee Venkatest R ignored “a genuine” penalty call and gave an “unnecessary” booking to midfielder Souvik Chakrabarti, who had eventually received a marching order.“Throughout the last 10-12 years we had to bear the brunt of biased refereeing, be it in the ILeague or more so in the ISL,” club secretary Rupak Saha said in a statement.“The step-motherly treatment in ISL has made us wonder whether the ISL is still being run in the spirit of one-city-one-club with which it was envisaged originally,” he further noted.Meanwhile, the AIFF chief refereeing officer Trevor Kettle has backed Venkatesh’s decision, saying East Bengal were not denied a penalty in the derby in Guwahati, which Mohun Bagan SG won 1-0, their ninth win in 10 meetings against the city rivals in ISL.“These people (like Kettle) have made Indian football a laughing stock and forced us to reach the minister’s office for his intervention,” senior East Bengal official Debabrata Sarkar said.
Article Summary: East Bengal have taken their grievance to the doorstep of Union sports minister. The club is understood to have sent a missive to Mansukh L Mandaviya on Tuesday night. The move came close on the heels of their latest loss to Mohun Bagan SG in the ISL.

Article Title: Premier League: Liverpool frustrated by Nottingham Forest, Manchester City blow late lead at Brentford
Article Text:
Liverpool's Diogo Jota (in white) scores his side's opening goal during the English Premier League match against Nottingham Forest. (AP)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

Man City,

Chelsea

stumble

Manchester City's Phil Foden (second left) celebrates after scoring against Brentford. (AP)

Chelsea's Cole Palmer (top) celebrates with teammates after scoring against AFC Bournemouth. (AP)

Liverpool 's charge towards the Premier League title was halted by stubborn Nottingham Forest in a 1-1 draw between the top two on Tuesday as Manchester City 's resurgence came undone in a 2-2 draw at Brentford.Chris Wood fired Forest in front early on at a raucous City Ground, but Liverpool dominated almost the entire 97 minutes and got back on level terms thanks to substitute Diogo Jota's goal with his first touch.Only a brilliant goalkeeping performance from Matz Sels denied the leaders victory, but the point maintained a six-point cushion over Forest for Arne Slot's men, who also have a game in hand.Forest had won their last seven games in all competitions to raise the possibility of matching Leicester's incredible title win of 2015/16.The in-form Wood had the home fans believing after just eight minutes when he slotted in Anthony Elanga's pass.Liverpool enjoyed over 70 percent possession and had 23 shots on goal but only posed a serious threat in front of goal after the break.Jota had only been on the field a matter of seconds when he nodded in Kostas Tsimikas' corner.Sels then made incredible saves to deny Jota, Mohamed Salah and Cody Gakpo a winner, while Salah also had a goalbound effort cleared off the line."I could not have asked for more," said Slot. "Second half was outstanding."There are not many teams that can create so many chances against an opponent so defensively strong. Unfortunately we couldn't get a second."Liverpool's second consecutive league draw opens the door for Arsenal to cut the gap at the top to four points when they host Tottenham in the north London derby on Wednesday.Any suggestion City could get themselves back in the title race was ended in a late collapse in west London as Brentford struck twice in the final 10 minutes for a deserved point.Phil Foden's double had City on course for a fourth consecutive win after a run of just one victory in 13 games.However, the English champions' defending was not convincing all night and they were punished as Yoane Wissa and Christian Norgaard netted for the Bees.Foden's return to the form that saw him crowned Premier League player of the year last season was the one positive for City.But Pep Guardiola will reflect on a missed opportunity to make up ground on the top four as City remain down in sixth, 12 points off the top.Foden produced a brilliant deft touch from Kevin De Bruyne's inviting delivery and then smashed in a rebound for his fourth goal in five league games.Brentford wasted a host of chances before conceding but finally got some reward for their attacking endeavour when Wissa slotted in from Mads Roerslev's cross to become the club's all-time leading goalscorer in the Premier League.They completed the comeback in stoppage time when Norgaard's header had too much power for Stefan Ortega."We are not (at our best) and we didn't take the right decisions," said Guardiola. "It's fine, it's not a good place to come. Unfortunately, we couldn't win."Fourth-placed Chelsea's miserable run extended to five league games without a win but they were grateful for captain Reece James' stoppage-time equaliser salvaging a point in a 2-2 draw at home to Bournemouth.Cole Palmer's cool finish from Nicolas Jackson's through ball had given Chelsea the perfect start.But Bournemouth hit back through Justin Kluivert's penalty, before Antoine Semenyo's blistering near-post effort put the visitors in front.James has endured another injury-hit season but showed his quality by curling home a free-kick at the death.West Ham boss Graham Potter enjoyed a winning home debut as Fulham were beaten 3-2 at the London Stadium.Carlos Soler, Tomas Soucek and Lucas Paqueta were on target for the Hammers to take Potter's men above Manchester United and Tottenham into 12th.
Article Summary: Liverpool held to 1-1 draw by Nottingham Forest at the City Ground. Manchester City held 2-2 by Brentford at the Macron Stadium. Chelsea held to a draw by Bournemouth at Stamford Bridge. Fulham beaten 3-2 at home by West Ham.

Article Title: Novak Djokovic 'big fan' of Danielle Collins
Article Text: Tennis great Novak Djokovic applauded Danielle Collins for her witty response to the Australian crowd's heckling during her second-round match. Collins humorously stated that the hecklers' ticket money would fund her next five-star vacation. Djokovic admired her handling of the situation, acknowledging the challenges of dealing with constant provocation from spectators.
Article Summary: Novak Djokovic applauded Danielle Collins for her witty response to the Australian crowd's heckling during her second-round match. Collins humorously stated that the hecklers' ticket money would fund her next five-star vacation. Djakovic acknowledged the challenges of dealing with constant provocation from spectators.

Article Title: 'I'm just two years older!': Carlos Alcaraz on Next Gen stars
Article Text:
Carlos Alcaraz. (Pic Credit - X)

In a fortnight where new names and fresh faces have taken over the conversation -- Joao Fonseca, Jakub Mensik and Learner Tien -- to name a few, 21-year-old Carlos Alcaraz reminded the tennis world he was only a couple of years older than the ‘next generation’ of talents everyone is talking about.Alcaraz, the third-seeded Spaniard, playing on Rod Laver Arena for the first time in this edition of the tournament, flaunted staggering range as he moved past Nuno Borges 6-2, 6-4, 6-7 (3), 6-2 to claim a spot in the fourth-round of the Australian Open .Alcaraz -- bidding to become the youngest player to complete the career Grand Slam in men's singles history – said he had watched all of the games’ young talents, including 19-year-old left-hander Tien, who put out Daniil Medvedev late on Thursday.“I have seen those players, I have seen the level that they have. I didn't watch too much of Tien for example, but I watched a little bit last night and it was incredible. I don't know which ranking they are going to reach, but they have a lot of potential,” he said.“I'm talking like I'm 30 years old,” he said, smiling before adding, “I mean, I'm just two years older than them!”“They are getting experience in every tournament they play. On Thursday night we saw Tien beating Medvedev here and Fonseca playing his first five-set match as well,” Alcaraz said. “They're going to become even more dangerous. Let's see in the future.”Meanwhile, Novak Djokovic continued to work his way through the draw, looking for a historic 25th major title.The 37-year-old Serb charged to a 6-1, 6-4, 6-4 win over the dangerous Czech Tomas Machac in 2-hours and 22-minutes to advance into the fourth-round in Melbourne Park for a 17th time. It was a match in which Djokovic played more than his opponent, taking on a section of the crowd that heckled him.The seventh seed, now 97-9 in his most rewarding tournament, will take on Czech Jiri Lehecka in the fourth-round on Sunday.
Article Summary: Carlos Alcaraz beats Nuno Borges to reach fourth-round of Australian Open. The third-seeded Spaniard is bidding to become the youngest player to complete the career Grand Slam in men's singles history. Novak Djokovic continues to work his way through the draw, looking for a historic 25th major title.

Article Title: Belinda Bencic scripts classic comeback tale at Melbourne Park
Article Text:
Belinda Bencic. (Pic Credit - X)

If there’s a copybook style, a five-step rubric of how to return to the professional Tour after a maternity break, Belinda Bencic must have her name on it.The 27-year-old Swiss, an Olympic gold medallist in the singles, ranked in the game’s top-five some five years ago, gave birth to daughter Bella in April last year.On a windy Friday evening at Melbourne Park, when the air current played havoc with the ball toss, whipped up skirts and sent balls stray, Bencic, looking like she might’ve never really left the game, reached the Australian Open fourth-round in only her sixth tournament back after giving birth to daughter Bella eight months ago.Bencic, who climbed to No. 156 in the WTA Live rankings after starting at 1000-plus last November, did well to survive the Naomi Osaka onslaught until the Japanese retired from the contest with a strained abdominal muscle, after the opening set of their third-round clash, billed the meeting of 27-year-old moms.Osaka, whose daughter Shai will be two in July, hit through the court, and took a 5-3 lead, but threw in the towel at the end of the first set which she lost in the tie-break. The world No 51 picked up the abdominal injury during her run into the final in Auckland, ahead of the Australian Open.After the two women exchanged hugs, Bencic wrote on the camera, ‘get well soon moma’.Bencic, who led the head-to-head 3-2, coming into Friday’s third-round clash, was asked about the message in her post match press conference. Was she addressing her own mother or Osaka? Bencic pointed at the former No.1.Earlier, ahead of their clash, when Osaka was asked if she had been in touch with the Olympic gold medallist, she produced a classic verbal shrug. ‘I haven't caught up with her because I actually haven't seen her,’ she said.When Osaka had protested against the press conference format in the summer of 2021, refusing to go through the routine at the French Open, Bencic was sceptical.“I respect Naomi’s decision, but media is part of the job and it contributes to a worldwide publicity we have and we get paid very well,” she said. “Naomi does a lot of good things. On the other hand, I feel like sometimes it’s just about to remain in the talk.”Osaka hadn’t forgotten, but Bencic clearly had moved past it.Bencic and her 42-year-old boyfriend Martin Hromkovic , a Slovak footballer, who is now her strength and conditioning coach, have proven to be a team.The fourth-round of the Australian Open was not on Bencic’s mind when she arrived here, in fact she wondered if she should even be playing at this level so soon after the birth of her daughter.“Before I would always have more expectations, if I would have bigger results, but it's not the case now,” she said. “I don't even have to remind myself, I think like my body just tells me. If I see Bella, I just see her being only eight-and-a-half months now.”“Really happy with how the comeback is going. I'm just happy with every match I get to play,” she said. “It's not really about winning right now, it's about improving myself and getting back there to be able to play the biggest tournaments again and be up there ranking-wise.”Next up for Bencic is the Tour’s hottest player World no.3 Coco Gauff .“Coco obviously is one of the best players in the world right now,” she said. “I was able to watch her a little bit when I was just lying on the couch for the last nine months.”On Sunday, Bencic will stand across the court from the 20-year-old American, who is yet to drop a set this year.
Article Summary: Belinda Bencic reached the Australian Open fourth-round in only her sixth tournament back after giving birth to daughter Bella eight months ago. The 27-year-old Swiss, an Olympic gold medallist in the singles, ranked in the game’s top-five some five years ago.

Article Title: Vintage Novak Djokovic storms into Australian Open fourth round
Article Text:
Novak Djokovic. (Pic Credit - X)

NEW DELHI: A determined Novak Djokovic stormed into the last 16 of the Australian Open on Friday, delivering a commanding performance that underlined his status as a 10-time Melbourne champion. However, the 37-year-old required a medical timeout and used an inhaler during the match.After dropping a set in each of his first two matches, Djokovic came out with renewed purpose against the dangerous 26th-seeded Czech, Tomas Machac . The Serb dismantled his 24-year-old opponent in straight sets, winning 6-1, 6-4, 6-4 in 2 hours and 22 minutes.This victory marked Djokovic’s 66th appearance in the last 16 of a Grand Slam , putting him just three behind Roger Federer’s record of 69 and well ahead of Rafael Nadal’s 54.Next, Djokovic will face another Czech, Jiri Lehecka , who advanced after defeating France’s Benjamin Bonzi in straight sets. A potential blockbuster quarterfinal against Carlos Alcaraz looms if Djokovic progresses further."I think I played really well, honestly. Very happy with my game," said the seventh seed. "I was slightly surprised to beat him in straight sets. He was a break up in the second, and I struggled physically, but I managed to turn it around. In the third set, I felt fresh, moved well, and was very pleased with my performance. There's always room for improvement, but this was definitely my best match of the tournament."With his new coach Andy Murray providing support from the stands, Djokovic began with a focused intensity. The match stayed on serve until the fourth game, where Djokovic broke Machac to move ahead 3-1. The veteran then went on a tear, winning three consecutive games to seal the first set.In the second set, Djokovic was broken early but responded immediately with a break of his own. Leading 2-1, he called for medical treatment and used an inhaler before resuming play. He broke Machac again for a 3-2 lead and maintained his composure to close out the set, celebrating with a fist pump and a roar to the crowd."I was trying to catch my breath," he said afterward. "I'm not 19 anymore — more like 19 times two, almost."Djokovic left the court between sets, and upon his return, a Machac double fault gifted him an early advantage in the third. The Serb never looked back, cruising to victory with a commanding performance.Last year, Djokovic was stopped in the Melbourne semifinals by eventual champion Jannik Sinner, ending a streak of winning at least one major every year since 2017. His dominant display against Machac serves as a reminder that he remains a force to be reckoned with as he pursues a record-breaking 25th Grand Slam title.
Article Summary: Novak Djokovic beats Tomas Machac 6-1, 6-4,6-4 to reach last 16 of Australian Open. The 37-year-old Serb needed a medical timeout and used an inhaler during the match. He will next face Jiri Lehecka, who beat Benjamin Bonzi in straight sets.

Article Title: Australian Open: Impressive Coco Gauff rolls past Leylah Fernandez into last 16
Article Text:
Coco Gauff (AP Photo)

NEW DELHI: 18-year-old American tennis sensation Coco Gauff continued her impressive start to the 2023 season with a convincing straight-sets victory over Leylah Fernandez in the third round of the Australian Open .The world number three, widely considered one of the favourites for the Melbourne title, showcased her dominance on the court, cruising to a 6-4, 6-2 win against the 30th-seeded Canadian on Rod Laver Arena.Gauff's unbeaten streak this season now extends to eight matches, having won all five of her singles matches at the United Cup, including a previous encounter against Fernandez, where she emerged victorious with a 6-3, 6-2 scoreline.Despite their familiarity, Gauff acknowledged the challenge posed by her opponent, stating, "Leylah is a great competitor, great player, great person, so I knew today was going to be a tough match regardless of the result a couple of weeks ago."The young American's performance was marked by her ability to seize control of the match, breaking Fernandez's serve midway through the first set and securing a double break early in the second.Although Fernandez briefly threatened a comeback, Gauff swiftly extinguished her hopes, breaking again and closing out the match in style with a series of blistering winners.Gauff, the reigning US Open champion , is aiming to surpass her previous best performance at the Australian Open, where she reached the semi-finals last year before falling to Aryna Sabalenka .This year, she is projected to face the world number one and defending champion at the same stage, setting the stage for a highly anticipated clash.Before that potential encounter, Gauff will face Belinda Bencic in the fourth round, as the Swiss advanced after Naomi Osaka retired due to injury.With her unwavering determination and impressive form, Gauff continues to solidify her position as one of the rising stars in women's tennis , captivating audiences with her skill and poise on the court.
Article Summary: 18-year-old American tennis sensation Coco Gauff continued her impressive start to the 2023 season with a convincing straight-sets victory over Leylah Fernandez. The world number three is widely considered one of the favourites for the Melbourne title. Gauff will face Belinda Bencic in the fourth round, as the Swiss advanced after Naomi Osaka retired due to injury.

Article Title: Naomi Osaka retires injured in Australian Open third round
Article Text:
Naomi Osaka receives medical attention during her match against Belinda Bencic. (Getty Images)

NEW DELHI: Two-time Australian Open winner Naomi Osaka retired due to an injury sustained during her third-round match against Belinda Bencic in Melbourne on Friday.After requiring medical attention for her stomach at 6-5 in the opening set, which she lost to her Swiss opponent via tiebreak, Osaka shook her hands and walked off the court.Osaka had a difficult run leading up to the year's first Grand Slam, withdrawing from the Auckland final due to an abdominal issue.The Japanese star also disclosed last week that she had broken up with Cordae, her rapper boyfriend and the father of her daughter Shai.However, the former world champion arrived in Melbourne with a sense of confidence, claiming that her injury was getting better."I'm pretty optimistic about playing my match. I mean, for sure I'm going to play my match," she said before the start of the tournament."I've been practising pretty well for the two days that I've been here, so it seems to be going good."With convincing victories over Caroline Garcia and Karolina Muchova, Osaka, a four-time Grand Slam champion, advanced to the Slam's third round for the first time since Shai's birth.However, both played to three sets at Melbourne Park and were obviously exhausted.Osaka led Bencic 5-2 in the opening set before being hindered by her movement and serve, which allowed Tokyo Olympic winner Bencic to equalize the match and force a tie break, which she won 7-3.Osaka was unable to continue and waved to the crowd as he departed John Cain Arena ."It's not the way you want this match to end. I thought it was getting to be a good match," Bencic said."Hopefully she will be fine soon and can play well for the rest of this year."
Article Summary: Two-time Australian Open winner Naomi Osaka retires from her third-round match against Belinda Bencic. Japanese star required medical attention for her stomach at 6-5 in the opening set, which she lost to her Swiss opponent via tiebreak. Osaka had a difficult run leading up to the year's first Grand Slam due to an abdominal issue.

Article Title: Australian Open 2025: Carlos Alcaraz drops a set before reaching fourth round
Article Text:
Carlos Alcaraz celebrates a point against Nuno Borges. (Photo by Quinn Rooney/Getty Images)

NEW DELHI: Carlos Alcaraz lost a set before muscling into the Australian Open round of 16 on Friday, bringing him one step closer to becoming the youngest person in history to win a career Grand Slam.The Portuguese world number 33 Nuno Borges was eliminated from the event 6-2, 6-4, 6-7 (3/7), 6-2 on Rod Laver Arena by the 21-year-old third seed, who was a class above.After spending his first two games of the season in the nearby Margaret Court Arena, it was Alcaraz's first time on center court.He dominated from the baseline, banging out 54 winners and nine aces while enjoying the atmosphere as the sun shone."The last time I played here I lost, I really wanted to play here and get another win on Rod Laver," said the Spaniard, a four-time Grand Slam winner who is gunning for a first title in Australia."It's a privilege to feel the love here in Australia. I'm trying to play different tennis, that's what makes me enjoy playing tennis, what makes me smile on court."And to entertain the people as well, making them happy."Alcaraz is attempting to become the youngest person in the Open Era to win all four majors and complete a career Grand Slam. Rafael Nadal , his countryman, accomplished it in 2010 at the age of 24.If he succeeds, he will also become the youngest champion to win at Melbourne Park since 2008, when Novak Djokovic did the same.He is seeded to face the Serbian star in a thrilling quarterfinal, and he will need to defeat him to accomplish this.Alcaraz got off to a great start against Borges, winning a break right away when the Portuguese player scored a backhand under duress.Alcaraz's strong groundstrokes were too much for Borges, who defeated the now-retired Rafael Nadal to win his first ATP title last season. Borges lost the set after being broken again in game seven.When the Spanish player hit a forehand winner for the break and served out with his fifth ace of the day to secure a two-set lead, the 27-year-old gamely held on to a 4-4 lead in the second set.In the third set, Borges was on defense. In an exciting 16-point seventh game, he fought off two break points from Alcaraz to keep the set on serve.However, he wouldn't back down, and after a tie break, he shocked the world number three by decisively winning.Set four began with Alcaraz holding serve to love, but he was so fired up that he unleashed a stunning forehand winner for a break and ran to the end.
Article Summary: Carlos Alcaraz beats Nuno Borges in straight sets to reach Australian Open quarterfinals. The 21-year-old Spaniard is bidding to become youngest person to win a career Grand Slam. He is seeded to face Novak Djokovic in the last eight.

Article Title: Australian Open 2025: Alexander Zverev zooms into fourth round
Article Text:
Alexander Zverev after his victory against Jacob Fearnley. (Photo by Daniel Pockett/Getty Images)

NEW DELHI: In the third round of the Australian Open , second seed Alexander Zverev defeated Briton Jacob Fearnley in straight sets, accelerating his progress.At Margaret Court Arena , the 27-year-old German dominated his opponent, defeating him 6-3, 6-4, 6-4 in 2 hours and 2 minutes.Zverev's victory was his 28th Australian Open victory, trailing only Boris Becker in the record for most by a German player.The 23-year-old Fearnley, who is only at his second Grand Slam , was praised by Zverev."He's an incredible player," said Zverev, who is pursuing a maiden major crown after a decade of trying."He went through all the stages, he went to college, through the Challenger (series) and now he's on the big tour playing third round at a Grand Slam."So massive respect for him. He's only getting better."Zverev has been systematic throughout the tournament and hasn't lost a set, and he's hoping to improve on his semi-final performance from the previous year.In game six, he took the initiative. He gained the break after an eight-stroke rally after a Fearnley double fault gave him a chance. This was sufficient to take the set.In the second set, they traded early breaks before Zverev was allowed in again by a double fault by the Briton, and a badly played backhand at the net gave the German an insurmountable 5-4 advantage.In the third set, Zverev once again lost up an early break, but he immediately recovered to put pressure on Fearnley's service, move 4-2 clear, and then cruise to the finish line.Although Zverev had one of his best seasons in 2020, his best Grand Slams to date are still his runner-up results at the 2020 US Open and French Open
Article Summary: Second seed Alexander Zverev defeated Briton Jacob Fearnley in straight sets. The 27-year-old German dominated his opponent, defeating him 6-3, 6-4,6-4 in 2 hours and 2 minutes. It was his 28th Australian Open victory, trailing only Boris Becker.
